Pre-Game Insights: Rohit Sharma revealed that Shubman Gill is 99% available for the match after missing the opening two matches with illness.
India captain Rohit Sharma mentioned that the friendly conditions for seamers in Ahmedabad could work in favor of Shardul Thakur over Ravichandran Ashwin.
Pakistan captain Babar Azam emphasized that his team will try to give a good performance and break their winless record against India at World Cups.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad is expected to be filled with at least 100,000 spectators on Saturday night.
The conditions have generally favored the fast bowlers with 59 per cent of the wickets at the venue prior to this year's World Cup.
The forecast in Ahmedabad on Saturday is'sunny and very warm' with a top of 36C and humidity reaching 57 per cent.
Others: India have never lost to Pakistan in seven meetings in the 50-over World Cup since they first met in Australia in 1992.
Pakistan have won the only one-day international they've ever played at the Narendra Modi Stadium, chasing down India's 5-316 in a final ball thriller.
